member.name: T:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.ResizableToolStripDropDown
member.summary: A resizable .
member.remarks:
extends to support resizing by the user at run-time. Resizing is constrained to the limits set by and . If they have the same value, resizing is disabled. To have no upper limit, set MaximumSize to (0, 0).
Initially, the dropdown is sized to accomodate its Items, or to its MinimumSize, whichever is larger.
If any of the Items has its set to , it will automatically be resized when changes; otherwise the caller should handle the event.

member.name: M:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.ResizableToolStripDropDown.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

member.name: M:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.ResizableToolStripDropDown.Show(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Displays the at the default position relative to the specified control.
member.param: The control that is the reference point for the position.
member.remarks:
By default, the is displayed with its upper-left corner positioned immediately below the lower-left corner of . If there is insufficient screen-space available below the control, the will be positioned immediately above instead. If there is insufficient screen-space available to the right of the control, the will be positioned aligned with the control's right edge.
This is the recommended method to use when showing the dropdown.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.ResizableToolStripDropDown.AutoSize
member.summary: Infrastructure. This property is not relevant for this class.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the current value of the .
member.remarks:
When setting, the supplied value will be clipped to the current values of and . If no value is required, set to null.
Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value of the .
member.remarks:
If the contents of the are cleared, either by the user or programmatically by setting to null, will be set to DefaultValue.
When setting, the supplied value will be clipped to the current values of and . If no value is required, set to null.
Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.MinimumValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of the .
member.remarks:
When setting, if , or is less than the supplied value, it will be clipped. If no value is required, set to null.
Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.MaximumValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of the .
member.remarks:
When setting, if , or is greater than the supplied value, it will be clipped. If no value is required, set to null.
Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the number format of the .
member.remarks:
This defines the format in which numbers may be entered by the user and in which will be displayed. It does not impose any constraints on itself.
Setting this property will reset to .
Defaults to .

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.IntegerPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of integer digits which may be entered.
member.remarks:
Set to 0 for unlimited digits. If is , the maximum number of integer digits that can be displayed is 8.
Setting this property will reset to .
Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.DecimalPlaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of decimal digits which may be entered.
member.remarks:
If is not set to either or , this property is ignored.
The value must be in the range 1..15.
Setting this property will reset to .
Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.DisplayLeadingZeroes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether leading zeroes should be displayed.
member.remarks:
If true, the current will be displayed padded out with leading zeroes up to the current number of . If is 0, no leading zeroes will be displayed.
If is , this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting point of text selected in the .

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBox.SelectionLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of characters selected selected in the .

member.summary: Occurs when the value of changes.

member.summary: Specifies the number format of a control.

member.summary: Only the digits 0..9 may be entered.

member.name: F:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBoxFormat.SignedDecimal

member.summary: Only the digits 0..9 and the decimal-separator character of the current culture's NumberFormat may be entered.

member.name: F:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.NumericTextBoxFormat.Hexadecimal
member.summary: Only the digits 0..9 and the upper- and lower-case letters A..F may be entered.

member.name: M:Digitalis.GUI.RGBPicker.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.RGBPicker.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the RGB value.

remarks.para:
The behaviour of the alpha component of Value is determined by :
TransparencyMode When getting Value When setting Value
is always 255 is ignored
is the value set by the user in the UI is displayed in the UI
Any other value
If the user has selected Transparency in the UI, will be set to the current value of
If is less than 255 it will be treated as transparent
Raises the event when its value changes.

member.name: E:Digitalis.GUI.RGBPicker.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of changes.

member.name: P:Digitalis.GUI.RGBPicker.TransparencyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency mode.

remarks.para: supports three basic modes: no transparency, fixed transparency and variable transparency.
If TransparencyMode is set to 0 (or ) then the alpha component of is ignored when setting and set to 255 when getting.
If TransparencyMode is set to 255 (or ) when the alpha component of may be adjusted freely in the UI.

If TransparencyMode is set to any other value, the UI will display a checkbox which specifies whether represents a transparent colour. If checked, the alpha component of will be set to the current value of TransparencyMode.
Raises the event when its value changes.

member.name: E:Digitalis.GUI.RGBPicker.TransparencyModeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of changes.

member.name: T:Digitalis.GUI.Controls.ClipboardMonitor
member.summary: Provides an interface to the User32.dll clipboard-watching function.
member.remarks:
This is implemented as a Control in order to receive clipboard messages, but it does not need to be added to your Form.
To use, create an instance and subscribe to the event. The Clipboard class is used to retrieve the clipboard data.

member.name: T:Digitalis.GUI.Forms.ProgressCallbackHandler
member.summary: Represents a method which is invoked to perform the background operation.
member.returns: true to continue the operation; false to cancel it.
member.remarks:
The delegate is invoked from a and should periodically report its progress by calling ReportProgress.
The delegate may choose to cancel the operation at any time by returning false.
